intro: Marshallfieldia corallina, commonly known as the coral lily, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, coral-like flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, humid environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces a tall, slender stem that supports its vibrant floral display. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections worldwide.
